dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c Brooks b Motie 97 (99b 10x4 3x6 149m) SR: 97.97

dismissalComment.html: Slashed and it's taken brilliantly at backward point! It was fullish, quite wide, Dhawan was on one knee and tried to pierce the gap behind square on the off side but holed out as Brooks flew to his right, tried to grab it with both hands together and ended up taking it with his right hand.

images.caption: Shubman Gill and Shikhar Dhawan laid a strong foundation
images.longCaption: Shubman Gill and Shikhar Dhawan laid a strong foundation, West Indies vs India, 1st ODI, Port-of-Spain, July 22, 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Shubman Gill run out (Pooran) 64 (53b 6x4 2x6 83m) SR: 120.75

dismissalComment.html: Direct hit at the bowler's end, is Gill struggling? He works the back of a length ball towards the right of midwicket and calls through for one. Pooran does well to quickly get to the ball and nail down the stumps to catch Gill short. Gill didn't expect Pooran to get to the ball quickly and hit the stumps and was jogging for the early past of the run. Costs him his wicket after looking so good. Is this the opening West Indies need?

headshotImage.caption: Shreyas Iyer player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shreyas Iyer player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Stunning one-hander taken at cover by Pooran! Iyer made room and tried to drive the full ball inside-out over cover. But Pooran timed and leapt with precision and plucked it with an outstretched right hand. Motie jumped as if vicariously, he almost jumped higher than Pooran.

dismissalText.commentary: Suryakumar Yadav b Hosein 13 (14b 2x4 0x6 22m) SR: 92.85

dismissalComment.html: Chopped on! SKY tried the cut, but it did not bounce as much as he expected. The length ball outside off may have turned away a bit too, took the underedge and went back on to the stumps. Hosein points to the heavens after getting his man.

dismissalText.commentary: Sanju Samson lbw b Shepherd 12 (18b 0x4 1x6 31m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Length ball beats the flick and hits the pad, appeal for an LBW is upheld. Samson reviews. Nothing on UltraEdge. It's Umpire' call as the ball is clipping leg stump. Samson has to go. The ball came in with the angle, Samson tried to flick it across the line. It may have kept a bit lower than expected. It looked adjacent.

images.caption: Romario Shepherd played his part in a late West Indies fightback
images.longCaption: Romario Shepherd played his part in a late fightback, West Indies vs India, 1st ODI, Port-of-Spain, July 22, 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Mayers c †Samson b Thakur 75 (68b 10x4 1x6 110m) SR: 110.29

dismissalComment.html: Thakur gets another! Thick outside edge to the keeper! It was full and wide, Mayers reached out while standing still and tried to drive it through point. The bat was close to the ground, there were two sounds. One was off the edge. Nonetheless, an excellent innings from Mayers.

dismissalText.commentary: Brandon King c Iyer b Chahal 54 (66b 2x4 2x6 103m) SR: 81.81

dismissalComment.html: Holes out at deep extra! Chahal loops it up in his final penultimate over, kept it full and invited the inside-out shot. King went for it, went up off the edge. The hard power was fizzled and it went to Iyer who took a comfy catch. Another good innings ends.

image.caption: Shai Hope player portrait
image.longCaption: Shai Hope player portrait, West Indies media day

headshotImage.caption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Siraj has the last laugh as Hope is bounced out! Banged in short, Hope's weight is on his front foot. He tries to pull but in vain. Gets a top edge that flies straight to Thakur at deep third. The early wicket India would have wanted is here and it is in the form of Hope, who has the ability to seamlessly shift gears in this format.

headshotImage.caption: Nicholas Pooran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nicholas Pooran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Slogged, off the bottom, and it's taken at mid-on! It was full, outside off. Pooran went across and tried to swing it wide of mid-on but he went off-shape and the ball went on a flat trajectory, not too quick, for Krishna to take it with fingers pointing up.

headshotImage.caption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Chahal does him, caught at slip! It was full, slow, and spun away outside off (sixth/seventh stumpish line). Powell was magnetted by the line of the ball, he went searching with a slightly tentative bat-face looking at cover. It went low to the left of slip who took it well.

dismissalText.commentary: Shamarh Brooks c Iyer b Thakur 46 (61b 4x4 1x6 82m) SR: 75.4

dismissalComment.html: Catching practice for deep square leg and Lord strikes! Breaks the 117-run stand and Brooks cannot believe what he has done. Short ball outside off, fetches the pull straight to Iyer at deep backward square leg. Hands aloft for Thakur because he has delivered despite being hit.

images.caption: Shardul Thakur celebrates after dismissing Shamarh Brooks

dismissalComment.html: Holes out at deep extra! Chahal loops it up in his final penultimate over, kept it full and invited the inside-out shot. King went for it, went up off the edge. The hard power was fizzled and it went to Iyer who took a comfy catch. Another good innings ends.

commentPreTextItems.html: He needs four more for the super over, six for West Indies to win. Four boundary riders on the leg side.

commentTextItems.html: Siraj goes for the yorker, gets it between his legs. Shepherd swung, got an edge and it went to the keeper. That's all they can manage.

commentPostTextItems.html: On that note, let's call it a day. An exhilarating one at the cricket. The pitch played well, the gameplay was win-oriented. The ebbs and flows, the hold on attention was exemplary of good ODIs. Hope this is a sign of things to come and that you enjoyed our coverage. See you again for the next one. For now, it's ciao from me, Ekanth, on behalf my commentating, report-writing dynamo, Sudarshanan, and our scorer, Thilak.
Nazim: "Here is the beauty of ODI Format. It's entertaining, glamorous. A player can be proved here. Cricket means ODI "

Shareef: "I believe Mohammed Siraj deserved the 'player of the match' award for holding his nerve in the most decisive moments of the match, leading the pace pack and landing those unplayable yorkers (along with 2 wickets to his name, one of the skipper Pooran at a crucial time, strangling him with consistent line "

Shikhar Dhawan, POTM (97 off 99) and India Captain: (On not getting 100) It was disappointing but grateful for 97. I enjoyed it. It was difficult as it was holding a bit and turned. When Shubman, Shreyas and I were batting, we wanted to go big and make it easy for the youngsters. We had nerves as we didn't expect them to come this close. Fine leg went back and two three boundaries were stopped there which helped. We thought of using the bigger side, we gave doubles to fine leg. One of them should have been a run out but not everyday is a perfect day. We have to get better.

Nicholas Pooran, West Indies Captain: It feels like a win, bittersweet. We batted fifty overs, we're trying to figure it out continuously. Hopefully, we can get better with time. (India's 35-40 overs) Credit to the bowlers, it's a good track. We spoke and thought of restricting them to 315. Akeal, Alzarri, everyone stood up. We ticked fielding, batting to the end which was great. It's difficult to lose but we will take this one. We need to believe in each other and develop. We'll have a lot of challenges but are moving in the right direction.

Indeed it has. The game had the pattern of good starts continue this innings. Mayers and Brooks put on a 117-run stand for the second wicket. Pooran got a start. King, Hosein, and Shepherd made significant contributions to ensure wickets did not stall the runs. West Indies fell just three short. The yorkers that India persisted with did go wrong now and again, more due to where it went rather than the execution, but it paid off eventually. Chahal was good as always. Thakur was expensive but took wickets so it's all normal. Excellent match to start the series.
Eli Gew: "Who says ODIs are not exciting? This games proves that ODIs can still be relevant!"
5:45 pm: Siraj pumps the air, gets a hug from his mates. Shepherd is down but he's been exceptional. The members of both teams shake hands with opposition's players.

commentTextItems.html: Wide yorker, jammed to long-off. They scamper for another two! Shepherd ran like a gazelle and has turned two into four runs in the last couple legal balls.
Makes room, tries to follow him but it's too full and wide. Samson saved it from going to the fence to leaping to his left.
Another yorker, follows him. It's jammed to long leg, Prasidh runs in and throws it to the non-striker's end. No one backing up. Long-on, it seemed, ran in but not near enough. They make two.
Yorker, tries to slog it, gets it off the inside edge through fine leg for four!
Shuffles across, tries to ramp it. It hits him on the ankle as the feet swooped from down leg to wide outside off, hit him there and went to the vacant part at point.
Wide yorker, in the tramline. Beats the attempted jam towards point.
Edged, four! Get the cliches out, flashed flashed hard. It was full and wide, the fortune favoured the brave and it went past deep third for four.

commentPostTextItems.html: Money: "I will get a better sleep if you can help me with my query, Ekanth. Why not Deepak over Prasidh for his economic spell? Please :(" Because Prasidh's suitable. He bowled decently to be fair.

commentTextItems.html: Yorker on middle, swung along the ground to deep square leg. Prasidh seemed to have a word with Hosein who stood quietly, he goes back.
Pulls a short ball from outside off to long-on.

commentPostTextItems.html: Noor: "Shouldn't 48.2 be called a wide?" He'd gone far across, which may have gone against him.

commentTextItems.html: Wide, this time on a length. Shepherd tried to swat it over cover but missed. He jumps and smiles knowing he missed out.

Wide yorker, Shepherd swings off balance, it goes to the keeper. Umpire says it's caught behind. Shepherd reviews. Big gap between bat and ball. It went over, bat hitting ground made the sound. Decision reversed.
Pumped downtown, clears long-on! It was full, the yorker was not missed by much. Shepherd connected.

commentPostTextItems.html: Sudarshanan's checked yorker ball-by-ball data this innings. India have bowled 13 yorker and conceded 16 runs in this innings as opposed to five runs in eight balls by WI bowlers

commentTextItems.html: Well, another attempted yorker ends up as a full toss. Shepherd swings too hard, goes to long-off for one. This deserved four but the last ball got it.

commentPostTextItems.html: Shoeb: "Siraj is landing those yorkers pretty well!" Yeah, next level.

commentTextItems.html: Nails another yorker, unfortunately it takes the inside edge off the flick and goes through long leg. Shepherd's front foot was out of the way and it natmegged unintentionally.
Yorker outside off, jammed to cover.
Full, the yorker following him is jammed to midwicket.

commentPostTextItems.html: Rajesh Sanghvi: "Akeal playing a very sensible innings. "

commentTextItems.html: Makes room, Siraj lands a yorker on fifth stump. Tails back in again. The batter could not reach out as it seemed too far. Let go.
Full on the boot, it tails in which beats the flick. But the ricochet takes it fine well to the left of the keeper through long leg for four.
Last ball of Chahal, Shepherd goes after it with a lofted cover drive. Finds the deep fielder on a couple bounces. It was full and wide.

commentPostTextItems.html: Karan: "Test cricket feels more entertaining than one day these days." Entertainment is subjective but there's a case to be made there.

dismissalText.commentary: Shubman Gill run out (Pooran) 64 (53b 6x4 2x6 83m) SR: 120.75

dismissalComment.html: Direct hit at the bowler's end, is Gill struggling? He works the back of a length ball towards the right of midwicket and calls through for one. Pooran does well to quickly get to the ball and nail down the stumps to catch Gill short. Gill didn't expect Pooran to get to the ball quickly and hit the stumps and was jogging for the early past of the run. Costs him his wicket after looking so good. Is this the opening West Indies need?

dismissalText.commentary: Shreyas Iyer c Pooran b Motie 54 (57b 5x4 2x6 76m) SR: 94.73

dismissalComment.html: Stunning one-hander taken at cover by Pooran! Iyer made room and tried to drive the full ball inside-out over cover. But Pooran timed and leapt with precision and plucked it with an outstretched right hand. Motie jumped as if vicariously, he almost jumped higher than Pooran.
